addon.name: phpLive! Support
addon.description: Adds the phpLive chat support system to your storefronts. Download Here.

item.name: Enable Addon?
item.tooltip: Allows you to enable/disable this addon on a per-store basis.

item.name: Base Domain
item.tooltip: The domain where live chat is installed, including protocol and subfolder. Please note that protocol can be reletive (//). Do not include trailing slash. Example: https://chat.example.com.

item.name: Z-Index
item.tooltip: Z-index is a CSS property that sets position in the layers of the page. The greater the z-index, the "higher" the element is in the stack. Defaults to 1000. Example: 3000

item.name: ID
item.tooltip: The unique ID used for the live chat widget. This value MUST be a string of numbers. Example: 1234567890. If no value is supplied, a timestamp is used for ID.

item.name: Rendering
item.tooltip: The method used to load the phpLive script.

item.name: Online Image
item.tooltip: The image displayed for the chat online button.

item.name: Offline Image
item.tooltip: The image displayed for the chat offline button.

item.name: Position
item.tooltip: The location on the page for the online/offline button. If you choose right or left middle, adjust with rotation and offset below.

item.name: Rotation
item.tooltip: The rotation of the online/offline button. Use for attahching to the left or right middle position. Remember to include the deg. Example: -90deg

item.name: Offset
item.tooltip: The bottom offset of the online/offline button while in right or left middle position. Use combined with rotation to fit the button correctly. Example: 10px

item.name: Extra CSS
item.tooltip: Extra CSS styles that will be included on the online/offline button. Example: color: #434343;

item.name: Enable Mobile Support?
item.tooltip: Allows you to enable/disable support for mobile breakpoints.

item.name: Mobile Breakpoint
item.tooltip: The breakpoint at which online/offline button changes to mobile settings. Example: 768px

item.name: Mobile Position
item.tooltip: The location on the page for the online/offline button. If you choose right or left middle, adjust with rotation and offset below.

item.name: Mobile Rotation
item.tooltip: The rotation of the online/offline button. Use for attahching to the left or right middle position. Remember to include the deg. Example: -90deg

item.name: Mobile Offset
item.tooltip: The bottom offset of the online/offline button while in right or left middle position. Use combined with rotation to fit the button correctly. Example: 10px

item.name: Mobile Extra CSS
item.tooltip: Extra CSS styles that will be included on the online/offline button. Example: color: #434343;
